labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed for comprehensive travel planning, specifically focused on flight and accommodation searches. It utilizes the Duffel API to provide detailed search capabilities for one-way, round-trip, and multi-city flights, as well as travel stays. Users can specify preferences like cabin class, passenger count, and connection options, and access detailed offers and guest reviews. The available tools indicate functionality for flight and stay searches, offer details, multi-city searches, stay reviews, and more.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Travel & Maps" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around travel planning, including flight and accommodation searches, which aligns well with this category. The secondary label "Data Analysis & Processing" is relevant due to the ability to process and present detailed offers and guest reviews. The third label "Daily Productivity" is appropriate as the server aids in organizing and planning travel, enhancing personal productivity. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories cover the server's functionality adequately.

server_info_crawled.name: Flight and Stay Search Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Octember/flights-mcp-ts
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide comprehensive flight and accommodation search capabilities using the Duffel API. Search for one-way, round-trip, and multi-city flights, as well as travel stays with detailed offers and guest reviews. Enable users to specify preferences such as cabin class, passenger count, and connection options for tailored travel planning.

tools.name: search_flights
tools.description: Deploy Server Flight and Stay Search Server @Octember/flights-mcp-ts Try in Playground search_flights

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Octember/flights-mcp-ts/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: duffelApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: The API key for accessing the Duffel flight search service.
